    COVID_Quarantine

    COVID_Quarantine.Rmd
    library(CovidDataPackage1)

    Overview

    The COVID-19 Outbreak Risk Explorer is an interactive Shiny application included within the CovidDataPackage1 package.
    It allows users to explore how different factors such as vaccination rates, vaccine efficacy, testing frequency, and viral transmissibility (R₀) influence the overall probability of a COVID-19 outbreak under different variant scenarios.

    This app provides an interactive visual environment to replicate and extend the findings from the accompanying dataset covid_data, which is stored within the package. The dataset contains simulated information on key public-health parameters and their relationships to outbreak risk.

    Data Description

    The dataset covid_data includes the following variables:

    Variable Description
    variant The COVID-19 variant (e.g., Wildtype, Delta, Omicron).
    vaccination_rate Proportion of the population vaccinated.
    vaccine_efficacy Effectiveness of the vaccine in preventing infection.
    testing_freq_days Average number of days between population testing.
    R0 Basic reproduction number — the average number of secondary infections caused by one infected person.
    outbreak_risk Simulated probability of an outbreak occurring under the specified conditions.

    These variables can be explored interactively in the Shiny app to observe how changes in vaccination or testing policies might affect outbreak potential.

    Developed by Pranav Sajeev.

    Site built with pkgdown 2.1.3.
